traits.name: Combat Maneuvers (3/Short Rest)
traits.desc: Tacticians have trained all their life to excel in combat and as a result have mastered special combat maneuvers that they can use in combat. Whenever the tactician makes a melee weapon attack, it can choose to execute one of these maneuvers to add additional effects to the attack. In addition to these other effects, all maneuvers cause the attacks to deal an additional 1d8 damage. Each tactician has two random maneuvers from the list below available for use: * Crippling Strike – The target's speed is 0 on its next turn. * Dizzying Strike – Concentration saving throws made as a result of this attack's damage are made at disadvantage. * Precise Strike – This attack is made with advantage. * Weakening Strike – The next weapon attack made by the target deals half damage (rounded down).

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The tactician makes two attacks with its battleaxe and one with its unarmed strike..

actions.name: Battleaxe
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Unarmed Strike
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Handaxe
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 3) slashing damage.
